H0.text: DNA ligase seals the gap between two DNA fragments.

H1.text: Reductase is the enzyme that seals the gap between two DNA fragments.

H2.text: RNA ligase seals the gap between two DNA fragments.

H3.text: Enzymes seal the gap between two DNA fragments.

A4.text: DNA ligase is a type of enzyme that facilitates the joining of DNA strands together by catalyzing the formation of a phosphodiester bond.

A5.text: DNA ligases have become indispensable tools in modern molecular biology research for generating recombinant DNA sequences.

A6.text: DNA Ligase IV, a specialized DNA ligase that forms a complex with the cofactor XRCC4, directly joins the two ends.
